required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Endocrine Disorders Among Children Exposed to Lavender Essential Oil and Tea Tree Essential Oils

lead_sponsor.agency: Franklin School of Integrative Health Sciences

clinical_study.source: Franklin School of Integrative Health Sciences

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to explore the potential for an association between the development of prepubertal gynecomastia and history exposure to lavender essential oil, tea tree essential oil, and other essential oils.

detailed_description.textblock: After being informed about the study and privacy, parents will give informed consent and complete the APICHS (Aromatic Plant Ingredient & Child Health Survey), a validated measurement tool for determining exposure to plant-based ingredients in pediatric personal care products.

primary_outcome.description: The number of participants who were exposed to lavender and tea tree essential oils and had ever experienced prepubertal gynecomastia
The number of participants who were exposed to lavender and tea tree essential oils and experienced prepubertal gynecomastia

primary_outcome.measure: Endocrine Disruption - Comparison between exposed and unexposed
primary_outcome.description: The difference in rates of endocrine disorders between children who were exposed to lavender or tea tree essential oil and those who were not. Exposure is measured using the Aromatic Plant Ingredient and Child Health Survey (APICHS), which measures total exposure, providing a continuous variable ranging from 0 to unlimited exposures, and a dichotomous yes/no exposure outcome variable.

arm_group.description: Parents of children ages 2 to 15 years old will provide data using the APICHS.

intervention.description: There is no intervention; observation only.

study_pop.textblock: Parents of children aged 2 to 15 years old who live in the United States will be recruited for this study. Emphasis is placed on obtaining a diverse sample which all states and territories, in addition to a racially and SES diverse sample.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Parent of child aged 2-15 living in the United States
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
